name: aws-access-analyzer
label: AWS Access Analyzer
description: AWS Access Analyzer helps you identify the resources in your organization and accounts, such as Amazon S3 buckets or IAM roles, shared with an external entity, enabling you to identify unintended access to your resources and data, which is a security risk.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.description: Type of configuration using which you will provide credentials to access AWS Access Analyzer and perform automated actions. You can select between AWS Instance IAM Role or Access Credentials. If you select Aws Instance IAM Role, then enter details in the following field(s): AWS Instance IAM Role Name: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services. If you selectAccess Credentials, then enter details in the following field(s): AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer. AWS Access Key ID: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services. AWS Secret Access Key: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.

AWS Instance IAM Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role Name
AWS Instance IAM Role.name: aws_iam_role
AWS Instance IAM Role.tooltip: IAM Role Name of your AWS Instance where FortiSOAR installed, to access AWS services.
AWS Instance IAM Role.description: IAM Role Name of your AWS Instance where FortiSOAR installed, to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Region
Access Credentials.name: aws_region
Access Credentials.tooltip: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer
Access Credentials.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

Access Credentials.title: AWS Access Key ID
Access Credentials.name: aws_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services

Access Credentials.title: AWS Secret Access Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_secret_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: List Analyzers
operations.description: Retrieves a list of analyzers based on the analyzer type and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Analyzer Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Select the type of analyzers that you want to retrieve using AWS Access Analyzer. You can choose either 'ACCOUNT' or 'ORGANIZATION'.

parameters.title: Max Result Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the maximum size of analyzer list
parameters.description: Specify the maximum size of the analyzer list that you want to retrieve using AWS Access Analyzer.

parameters.title: Next Page Token
parameters.name: next_token
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the next page token. Not required for the first page. And you can find 'nextToken' value in first page data.
parameters.description: (Optional) The next page token is used for paginating through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. You can use this parameter to retrieve the next page records using the 'nextToken' value and it is not required for the first page.

operations.title: Get analyzer details
operations.description: Retrieves information about the specified analyzer based on the analyzer name and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role

If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Analyzer Name
parameters.name: analyzer_name

operations.title: List of Analyzed Resources
operations.description: Retrieves a list of specified resource types that have been analyzed by the specified analyzer based on the analyzer ARN, resource type, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Analyzer ARN
parameters.name: analyzer_arn
parameters.description: Specify the ARN of the analyzer whose analyzed resources you want to retrieve using AWS Access Analyzer.

parameters.title: Resource Type
parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Select the type of resources you want to retrieve using AWS Access Analyzer. You can choose from resource types such as AWS::IAM::Role, AWS::S3::Bucket, AWS::KMS::Key, etc.

parameters.title: Max Result Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the maximum size of analyzed resource list
parameters.description: Specify the maximum size of the analyzed resource list that you want to retrieve using AWS Access Analyzer.

parameters.title: Next Page Token
parameters.name: next_token
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the next page token. Not required for the first page. And you can find 'nextToken' value in first page data.
parameters.description: (Optional) The next page token is used for paginating through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. You can use this parameter to retrieve the next page records using the 'nextToken' value and it is not required for the first page.

operations.title: Details of an Analyzed Resources
operations.description: Retrieves information about a resource that was analyzed by the specified analyzer based on the analyzer ARN and resource ARN you have specified.

operations.title: Get Finding Details
operations.description: Retrieves information about the specified finding generated by the specified analyzer based on the analyzer ARN and finding ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role

If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

operations.title: Start Resource Scan
operations.description: Immediately starts a scan of the policies applied to the specified resource based on the analyzer ARN and resource ARN you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.name: session_name

true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Analyzer ARN
parameters.name: analyzer_arn
parameters.description: Specify the ARN of the analyzer using which you want to scan the policies on the specified resource.

parameters.title: Resource ARN
parameters.name: resource_arn
parameters.description: Specify the ARN of resources whose associated policies you want to scan using the specified analyzer.

operations.title: Update Findings Status
operations.description: Updates the status of the specified findings of a specified analyzer based on the analyzer ARN, resource ARN, findings IDs, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn

parameters.title: Analyzer ARN
parameters.name: analyzer_arn
parameters.description: Specify the ARN of the analyzer whose findings' status you want to update using AWS Access Analyzer.

parameters.title: Update By
parameters.name: update_by
parameters.description: Select options from which you want to update the status of findings.

Resource ARN.title: Resource ARN
Resource ARN.name: resource_arn
Resource ARN.description: Specify the ARN of resources whose findings' status you want to update using the specified analyzer.

Findings IDs.title: ID List
Findings IDs.name: ids
Findings IDs.description: Specify a comma-separated list of findings' IDs whose status you want to update using AWS Access Analyzer.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Select the status of the specified findings as either 'ACTIVE' or 'ARCHIVED'.
parameters.description: Select the status of the specified findings as either 'ACTIVE' or 'ARCHIVED'.

parameters.title: Client Token
parameters.name: client_token
parameters.description: Specify the client token to update the status of the specified findings.
